reviews.text: The location is excellent for anyone attending a convention at the Moscone Convention Center. I found the room to be clean, quiet, and comfortable - all that I need when traveling on business.
reviews.title: Great Location for Conventions

reviews.text: The bar area in the lobby area is just "OK", but when in SF, why not go out to a bar and restaurant. There is no reason to stay in your hotel room when you are in San Francisco!
reviews.title: Nice but getting a bit dated

reviews.text: The hotel staff was amazingly nice and helpful from the parking valet to front desk and everywhere in between. Everyone seems to have been well-trained to make you feel welcomed and comfortable.
reviews.title: I love this place!

reviews.text: Hotel guests can park their car using Valet for $60 a day with unlimited in and out privilege.
reviews.title: Good hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I've been to many hotels in SF, and this one is in far better shape than most and certainly worth returning to again.
reviews.title: This hotel is approaching sleazy.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: At $149 (Labor Day weekend), the Marriott was OK. There were minor problems, like a toilet seat that would not always stay up and some street noise in our 14th floor room.
reviews.title: I'd go back again at this price

reviews.text: Comfortable beds, lousy pillows.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: Little hall noise, but what there was came right through the door.
reviews.title: Average Hotel

reviews.text: No noise from neighboring rooms, but no sign they were occupied.
reviews.title: Great Service, Wonderful Stay

reviews.text: Close to BART from the airport. $50/day parking. Good central location for mass transit.
reviews.title: Check your bill for incorrect charges

likes.liked: — nice room and easy access to downtown

reviews.text: I enjoyed staying here as it is close to several points of interest, bed was super comfy and the concierge staff were helpful. It was a surprise to find that the windows opened in my room, only a few inches, but enough for some fresh air. It is rare to find a high-rise hotel with windows like this.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel

reviews.text: When I arrived at the Marriott Marquis in San Francisco, I was informed that the hotel was overbooked and I would need to stay at the nearby Westin for one out of the two nights of my reservation. It was within walking distance so I didn't mind. the woman with whom I spoke promised to arrange for double Marriott points. Since I am an elite Marriott member I was pretty psyched about the offer. Having stayed in the Westin for one night, I checked with the front desk of Marriott to make sure that they had a roomf for me. The man I spoke to could not find my reservation although I provided the confirmation number. He had to get a manager to locate it and they informed me that I was only confirmed for one night -- not two. Regardless, they eventually found my reservation and, more importantly, a room for my second night. When I arrived in my room, it had a bit of an odor and it was very close to the elevator. It was a bit of a downgrade from the Westin. Although I've stayed in the Marriott Marquis many times over the years for various conferences, and find that it's a convenient hotel, I was a bit perturbed by the whole experience but nevertheless the double Marriott points I was promised were worth the hassle. Which leads to me to this review... I have called the Marriott twice and spent a good deal of time talking with several people about the points that were promised and never received. I was told that a manager would call me right away, but that was days ago. It seems that no one there knows what the other person does and reservations/confirmation numbers are lost. I suppose I just expected more from such a reputable chain of hotels, especially towards a regular customer who almost exclusively uses Marriotts worldwide.
reviews.title: Disorganization leads to Frustration

reviews.text: I recently stayed at the Marriott Marquis near Moscone Center. The hotel is of the quality you would expect from a upper level Marriott... meaning the rooms were very clean and the beds were comfortable. The hotel is an older one, I believe, so the rooms were a bit dated in terms of the "feel" but, nonetheless quite comfortable. The lobby is spacious and comfortable with a very helpful staff. In terms of food, the Mission Restaurant on the second floor served an "outstanding" Sunday brunch buffet with three distinct cuisines. There was a noodle soup bar with everything one could expect in a lovely Asian-type soup; a European style table of sausages, cheese, and cold vegetable salads; and the usual American specialties with a wide variety of freshly baked goods.
reviews.title: Good location for Events at Moscone Center

reviews.text: I have only one comment that concerned me and it was not with the actual hotel, per se. I am partially disabled and rely heavily on taxi and car services when I travel. Taking a tram or a cable car would be quite difficult. The hotel did not offer or even try to accommodate having a taxi service that I could use. They insisted that there would be plenty of taxis as my disposal in front of the hotel. This was mostly true, but I actually got "stranded" at the Wharf without being able to get back by taxi. There were none to be found and the Hotel was LESS than helpful in getting a taxi to meet me and return me to the hotel. It was very difficult not to have a phone number to call for a service. Most hotels will help in this situation and this lack of service caused much stress.
reviews.title: The staff is excellent

reviews.text: This was my second stay at the hotel and I was impressed even more. The hotel is in an excellent location: close to shops, Union Square, art museums and there's even a cinema right opposite the hotel. What makes the Marriott Marquis for me though, are the people that work there. Paul at the bell desk was incredibly friendly and helpful, giving us lots of information on wine tours, taking a lot of time explaining things-he made us feel like his friend yet treated us very respectfully. Then there is the manager Shelly, who welcomed most guests with a smile and a friendly chat. She was very visible to the guests and very friendly and approachable. Finally upon check out I was helped by Harold. Courteous and welcoming.
reviews.title: Great Location...Hotel Room Damp, Musty and Moldy!

reviews.text: This was a two night stay at the Marriott Marquis for a business trip. I requested a quiet room location and was placed on the 23rd floor, which is considered a 'high-rise' location. The room was free from most road/room noise and was one of the recently refurbished rooms. Given the recent furnishing update, the room was clean and in great shape.
reviews.title: Enjoyed the Marriott Marquis

reviews.text: The registration desk was very helpful, taking effort to find a room without doors to an adjoining unit. This helped to reduce room-to-room noise.
reviews.title: Convenient to BART and Cable Cars

reviews.text: The hotel location is very close to the Moscone Center but also within a short ten minute walk to Union Square. I didn't use a Marriott restaurant but did visit the lobby Starbucks.
reviews.title: Superb location for downtown San Francisco

reviews.text: My spouse was attending a conference at the Marriott Marquis SF so our rate was very reasonable for hotel in SF. The Marriott Marquis is conveniently located with the BART just a short walk away. The Powell/Market Cable Car terminal is also just about 2 blocks away. Best of all, the Apple Store is right across Market from the hotel. You can walk to the Financial District in about 15 minutes. There are numerous restaurants in the area. The desk clerks were very pleasant and helpful as were the personnel at the concierge desk. Our room was located on a high floor with a great view of the city. The room was quiet and clean. In-room wi-fi costs about $14/day but is very fast and reliable. There is valet parking available but it is pricey. SF is a city that you really can't have a car. We enjoyed our stay at the Marriott and look forward to visiting again.
reviews.title: Once again, Marriott customer service exceeds expectations

reviews.text: Stayed here three times in recent months, once in November and twice over the holiday period. It's become our hotel of choice if we are heading to the city for a night! Lovely, spacious rooms in a great central location. Have stayed on the concierge level twice, meaning that we have been able to avail of the coffee / continental breakfast / snacks - well worth it. We've stayed here both with and wthout our kids, and it's been perfect for all trips, great family friendly hotel. We'll be back!
reviews.title: Old, dirty, smell and inconsist quality of staff....disappointed at this Marriott

reviews.text: We Stayed at the S.F. Marriott for 3 nights. We arrived at the hotel and my first impression was that it was very modern, with sleek decor, very open and Cold, and a trendy bar downstairs. The front desk girl was nice, but seemed really confused as we were using our marriott points for the 3rd night. ( we were even locked out of our room our 3rd day,so she must have Really been confused. the room itself was roomy and clean, but nothing exceptional. We never went to the Pool/spa area, but the "view bar" at the top was spectacular, if you can find a seat next to the window. A negative to this hotel is if you take the corner, it gets a litte shady, and to end on a positive note, the Bellmen are extremely friendly and helpful. We asked one of a breakfast spot one morning, and He recommened "Wich Craft" and showed us directions. (the sandwiches were fantastic!).
reviews.title: on The outskirts...

likes.disliked: — The decor and lack of Personal attention

reviews.text: By morning 4, I was more than happy to leave and head elsewere. This is a good 1-2 night hotel.
reviews.title: Nice upscale Marriott location

likes.liked: — Overall appearance of property, room quality/cleanliness
likes.disliked: — Pricing for internet access; Extremely high parking charges

reviews.text: I recently stayed at the San Francisco Marriott for a conference. I came away with a positive impression of the property. The rooms were quite nice, definitely better than your standard business travel fare. Everything was clean and spacious. The lobby and convention/conference areas were in great shape and the staff was friendly and helpful. It was priced just about where I would expect for a hotel in downtown San Francisco (not cheap, but it wasn't outrageous either). I would definitely return here if I was visiting for non-business purposes.
reviews.title: Great staff, great stay

likes.disliked: — Pool hours were not adhered to.

reviews.text: We loved our stay here. The staff was wonderful. We booked on a Marriott Friends and Family discount, so we were not sure what we would get, but we had two nice connected rooms. The hotel was clean, and the staff was wonderful, everyone seemed genuinely happy. Room was nicely enhanced, flat screens, featherbeds, etc. They gave us a fridge at our request, no charge. As per prior posts, the pool seemed to have independant hours that changed at whim, and was not open when it should have been.
reviews.title: Very Nice Experience - Terrific Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The View Bar on the 39th floor was awesome. Kids allowed, they serve Shirley Temples, etc. Nice clean venue, fairly quiet gathering place. Seats fill early.
reviews.title: Very Nice Hotel

reviews.text: We've just returned from a three night stay at the Mariott. The staff was very helpful and always with a smile. The room and the bathroom were very clean and the bed very comfortable. The room size, though somewhat small, was typical of the size you would get at any major city . The bar on the 37th floor offers magnificent view of the city and is well worth the ride up the elevator.
reviews.title: A Good Stay

likes.disliked: — ask for a room with a view

reviews.text: The hotel is in a great location. It is near the shopping center, a 10 minute walk from China Town, a very short walk to the cable car, and around the corner from SF muesum of modern art.
reviews.title: Awesome Place

reviews.text: This hotel is a great place for both buisness and pleasure.
reviews.title: A very busy place!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked our room through Priceline.com and got a beautiful room for $125 a night on Friday and Saturday. Everything and everyone from the valet service to housekeeping was fantastic. The valet was full of information and was extremely kind. The bellboys were awesome. The front desk people more than went out of their way to help us. And the room was clean, newly-renovated, and extremely comfortable. The beds were to die for. The only drawback was that parking was $49 a night at the hotel. The valet recommended that we park just down the street at the Mission and Fifth Garage...we parked there for the whole weekend for $46. This hotel is close to shopping, close to the Powell/Market cable car stop, and is within footsteps to some of the world's best restaurants. Even the breakfast buffet at the hotel was great. We would stay here again any day!!!!
reviews.title: Had a great time

reviews.text: I came away with several impressions from my three-night stay. First, the Marriott is a very bustling and busy place. Lots of covention traffic. While I was there on vacation, the lobby was a vibrant center of activitiy. Yet once on my floor and my room, this was a great place to unwind and relax. I loved the oversized desk that overlooked the San Francisco skyline. No complaints at all with the room. The breakfast buffet was all I could ask for. Hotel location close to some good shopping and transportation to tourist attractiions. Staff was friendly and helpful. Visited the lounge on the 37th floor and it offered a great view, although a bit too crowded for me to enjoy a drink. But I can't fault it for being popular. This is really a business/conference hotel and probably is not geared to the typical tourist. Nonetheless, I was very satisfied with the accomodations and location of the Marriott. for my needs.
reviews.title: Great bar ; Great hotel ;Great city

reviews.text: I was in San Fran on business and my wife came with me. We chose the down town locations so she could have public transit during my work.
reviews.title: Great Hotel for price.

reviews.text: Other then the cost of Parking, which I know was high, everything was great.
reviews.title: Good Hotel Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The good: renovated rooms, good lobby with desks, power sockets and free wifi allowing you to work while you wait for a late flight, top floor bar/lounge with nice views. The bad: the elevators are noisy so ask for a room away from them, the hotel lacks character like most other business hotels. Would stay again at this hotel if on business trip. I stayed in a corner room that I enjoyed being in.
reviews.title: Shady Operators Taking Advantage of Innocents - Untrustworthy

reviews.text: There were issues with the reservation, the front desk, and the room choices. This establishment seems to exist on its special location and tolerates unethical employees (my opinion, Marriott condones unethical behavior, it is systemic and rewarded).
reviews.title: Should have been better from a Marriott Marquis

reviews.text: We reserved through a deal with AARP to get not only a 20% room rate reduction and free wifi. All clearly described in very large print with no disclaimers or exceptions which we brought with us to the Marriott front desk.
reviews.title: Smart hotel

reviews.text: We chose to stay at the SF Marriott having stayed there on several occasions prior (2008, 2006, 2004). Unfortunately this time we were not at all happy with our stay and will definitely not stay there again. The hotel is in a good location (heart of the downtown shopping area, however we have found that the overall standard of the hotel and the cleanliness has deteriorated over time. The rooms are exactly the same as when we stayed in 2004 and despite paying extra for a room upgrade, the room we were given certainly was not 'superior' and the amenities felt like it was the entry level room type. Cleanliness of the rooms leaves a lot to be desired with the bathroom not cleaned to a satisfactory level (hair on the floor, dirty toilet). My main concern and disappointment came when upon leaving our room on two occasions I noticed one of the hotel cleaners styling her hair in a guest room with the hairdryer. Once the cleaner noticed me looking, she promptly pushed the door shut - makes you wonder what happens in your hotel room when you are not there. I found this service to be unacceptable and very unprofessional. On several occasions during our stay we also checked our bill for the room to review our charges and noted that the hotel had charged us for internet useage we had not used. We brought this up with the front desk on several occasions and it was not rectified until check out where we had to justify that it be removed as we had not used the service. There are several other hotels in similar location which we will choose from when next travelling to San Francisco. We will definitely not be staying at the Marriott again.
reviews.title: Disappointed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great location and service. The concierge, Dan, was particularily helpful. Would return in a heartbeat.
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.text: Casey - Vancouver BC
reviews.title: unparalleled location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Got this hotel from Priceline and it was at an astonishing rate of sub $100 (before tax). For that weekend I was in SF, $100 could probably be a motel's rate...
reviews.title: Nice All Around Place to Stay

reviews.text: Hotel location is unparalleled. Half a block to BART Powell station 4th street entrance. 1 block to to Westfield San Francisco Center (and Bloomingdale's) with lots of shops in between, particularly a giant Old Navy store and 2 blocks to Union Square. Its the perfect place when you wanna shop in SF and be right in the middle of the happening.
reviews.title: Good Time in San Francisco

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We travel to the City about once per year for a weekend get-a-way. We booked the Marriott through priceline for about $90 per night and expected the worst (as it seems many hotels treat the priceline purchasers as second-class citizens.)
reviews.title: Simply no issues - Great Stay!

likes.liked: — Clean, large rooms and great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our experience was entirely positive. We arrived at 9:00 a.m. on Saturday and our room was already ready . The King bed we asked for was provided and was very comfortable. The room was nothing amazing, but it was large and clean as was the bathroom. The staff were friendly and helpful at all times.
reviews.title: A nice stay at SF Marriott

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is located just South of Market and is a quick walk to Union Square, North Beach and nearby museums. I wouldn't hestiate to recommend the Marriott . If I had paid $300 per night, I might not have been so happy, but at the priceline rate it was a steal.
reviews.title: Thank you for the room change!!

reviews.text: We stayed at SF Marriott on Dec. 30 and had a wonderful experience. The room was clean, the bed was comfortable, and the room was brightly lit. Some hotel rooms are not bright enough for reading even when all the lights are on. SF Marriott did not have this problem. The location was close to many major attractions. The valet staff was very helpful. Look forward to staying at SF Marriott again!
reviews.title: One of my favorites!

likes.disliked: — extra charges for internet, no in-room coffee

reviews.title: Real dissappointment
reviews.text: My wife and I were staying at the Marriott Downtown for December 30 and the 31st. The first night our room was adjacent to some early New Years Partyers. We kept thinking the noise would stop so we did not call security. The next day we voiced our concern with the front desk and we were promptly given another room on another floor. No questions nor hesitations (I am sure the hotel computer showed us as Priceline guests.....not a mention except for apologies for our inconvieniences). New Years Eve night was great.. Thank you to the management for making our stay First Rate!
The women in my extended family took this year's annual Christmas shopping trip and made it a 3 day event.
reviews.title: 9 women 2 rooms and 1 great stay!

reviews.text: Parking was a bit excessive ($50/nite) but safe valet in the city is worth it for me. And do take note of other members notes on the Taxi Scandal, it got a little rediculous mostly because we needed 2 cabs to go everywhere.
reviews.title: Average Marriot

reviews.text: Ok onto the Hotel itself:
reviews.title: Nice hotel, a little trouble with our reservation

likes.liked: — The beds and bedding were wonderful.
likes.disliked: — No rollaway when one was reserved.

reviews.text: Service was wonderful! we had a bellman named alfonso he took care of us for our entire stay. I have a thoery in big cities that you should always ask the bellman before you ask the concierge, you generally get better results. He moved our 2 tons of luggage in the hotel, then to move rooms, and unloaded us, then proceeded to give us great reccomendations. Then during a false fire alarm he brought out bottles of water while we waited for the 'all clear'
reviews.title: Ridiculous Valet/Taxi scam

reviews.text: The check in was quick and painless. They got our party 2 rooms that were adjacent which was helpful, the rooms were spacious for a hotel. (be sure to check the mini-bar; we had missing items at c/i that we would have been charged for had we not mentioned it to the f/d). The Marriott Bedding was wonderful as always!
reviews.title: Typical Convention Center Hotel

likes.liked: — The proximity to the Moscone Center

reviews.text: We spent four nights here for a conference—it was okay overall though we had some issues, which started right at check-in. When we got up to the room we saw we had been assigned a handicapped room though we didn’t request one. It was no big deal we assumed—just some bars around the toilet. After being in the room for a few hours we found the problem—the shower was designed for a wheelchair user ONLY. The showerhead height was designed for someone sitting and the hand held shower head could only be raised to a maximum height of about 4 feet 6 inches. When I called to complain reception offered to move us but by that time we had completely unpacked and there was stuff all around the room. In the end we opted not to move and sucked it up but every time we took a shower got angry about the situation. Have you ever tried to wash your hair with one hand? In addition, the water pressure on the 19th floor was dreadful—it was like being peed on, my husband joked.
reviews.title: Crowded Rooms, Friendly Staff

reviews.text: My experience with conference hotels such as Marriott and Hyatt is that rooms are generally sizable but this wasn’t the case with our room. It was just crowded with stuff and there was not a lot of empty space in the room. The closet, for example, had the ironing board and the safe on an overly large pedestal. This stuff took up so much room that there wasn’t room to open your suitcase up inside. Also, for a property that caters to business people, we found it strange that there was absolutely no free space on the desk/dresser area. There was the TV, connectivity equipment, hotel info binders and an enormous snack display (in addition to the minibar) that made your room look like a convenience store. Of course, the candy was out in the open to tempt you (see the review below about the property not losing a single opportunity to make money off guests) but it was also ugly and in the way and because of the sensors you couldn’t move it. In the end I threw my coat over it so I didn’t have to see it—it was right in your eye line when you were sitting on the bed. For anyone traveling with kids I can see the snacks causing problems.
reviews.title: great location

likes.disliked: — three sets of elevators going to different floors

reviews.text: There were some good points to the room though. I found the bed extremely comfortable. If you like a softer, pillowy mattress you’ll be happy here. There was a featherbed on the mattress and lots of pillows and the sheets felt nice and silky. The LG flat screen got a great picture on the digital channels and the hotel offered HBO. And the windows actually opened so you could get fresh air.
reviews.title: This hotel REALLY wants your money!

likes.disliked: — feeling I was being scammed at every turn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We got passes to the breakfast buffet for our trouble with the shower and I have to say it was quite good. Bottomless Illy coffee and fresh squeezed orange juice, made to order omelets and waffles, all the typical breakfast dishes, some nicer stuff like smoked salmon and a huge assortment of fresh fruit. If you were paying it was pricey though, at $22 a person. A la carte dishes were also available.
reviews.title: ~Loved The View Lounge

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The onsite Starbucks and Hertz rental desk were convenient. Also, the pool looked pretty nice; a good size for an indoor hotel pool and it had a nice area for lounging. The location is in walking distance to many SF tourist attractions, shopping and the convention center.
reviews.title: good and bad

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is your typical big city, big hotel. Very effective and many services available. Great Gym and the rooms are more then fine. The sky bar or whatever its called is very touristy and service is horrible. Besides that the hotel is filled with conventioneers due to its proximity to the moscone center. The location is great near Union square and a 10 minute walk from the Ferry Building. Didn’t try any of the restaurants in the hotel but the concierge recommendation was so, so…
reviews.title: Good - for under $300

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Got a great deal on a room through priceline ($150 tax and service included). The room we were assigned was absolutely amazing. A corner room with a king bed and wall to wall views of the hills and the bay. I personally really enjoy how Marriott uses down comforters with a washable sheet cover. Having a wife that works in a hotel, the first thing we usually do is strip the bed of the blanket since, if you're not aware, those things only get washed every few months and are absolutely disgusting at most hotels. Not so at Marriotts and a few other hotels that have switched to this method of bedding. Regardless, everything else was fantastic. The concierge and the bellmen were very professional. Getting us reservations and calling ahead for meals as well as watching our bags while we shopped on our final day. All around a fantastic experience.
reviews.title: Great Stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is in a good downtown location with easy access to plenty of bars and restaurants, as well as the superb local transport system. We stayed in a standard room which was very good. The hotel has a really good gym. Prices in the hotel are rather high for drinks and breakfast, but plenty of places nearby offering cheaper alternatives. Don't bother with a car - it's simple and cheap to use the buses and trams to get about.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: Would definitely visit again if I'm lucky enough to get the chance.
reviews.title: Good Location for Convention; not the greatest room

reviews.text: Location is excellent for conventions at Moscone Center. It is within easy walking distance to the Convention Center and located near several nice places to eat (also walking distance).
reviews.title: Great hotel, awesome location & excellent service!

likes.disliked: — Internet service - Had to pay for this service. Also, No WI-FI in room or concierge lounge

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just spent two nights at the Marriott. I've been to this hotel before for brunch and other things but never actually stayed the night. Our room was perfect. We had a corner room on the 29th floor with an incredible view of the city. The bed was super comfy. The bathroom was large enough. The great thing about the Marriott is the location. We like that it's on 4th Street and walking distance to shopping and a quick trip to just about anywhere in the city. The bar on the top floor was pretty cool. We had a drink up there late Friday night and it was a good atmosphere. Overall a great stay, would highly recommend.
reviews.title: Great Stay!

reviews.text: We stayed here for a meeting/convention at the Moscone West Convention Center. The hotel is about 2 blocks from the convention center. It's not too far, but the newly built Intercontinental Hotel is actually closer than the Marriott.
reviews.title: Not that great

likes.disliked: — Complicated paths to get to the room

reviews.title: Decent accomodation, would come back
reviews.text: The hotel was under construction at the time we were there, which made for terrible traffic inside the lobby area. Construction began right at 7am, so you might hear noises depending on where your room is. And because of the construction, you have to take different elevators to get to your floor. This added to a lot of inconvenience. To all readers, before thinking about staying here, check to see that their construction is completed. I don't think you would get your money worth if the construction was still going on.

Otherwise, the room is nice. Very modern and hi tech. Every room has hi-def TV. Bathroom has granite counter. Hotel is situated in a very convenient location. It's close to restaurants, shopping, etc.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel
Trip Report - Marriott and tours
reviews.text: Located in the centre of the city and sight seeing easy to access, close to congress centre and with congress accomodations within. Rooms clean, elegant set up, air conditioning a bit too cold but warm and cozy bedding.

Very conveniently located in the heart of the cit by the convention center. The hotel is enormous but well run. It is clean and well maintained. There are no surprises and that is why I like Marriott chains and this place is typical of Marriott Hotels but it is just big. You really can't go wrong choosing this hotel.
reviews.title: safe choice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The good: Very fast check in. Friendly and efficient staff.
reviews.title: Good Stay by The Bay

reviews.text: Room service dinner was fast and tasted good for
reviews.title: Good Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: hotel food.
reviews.title: Nice hotel - just so big!

likes.disliked: — Pool area could be better for such a large hotel

reviews.text: The area is has plenty to do and is close to BART.
reviews.title: Three Years in a Row...

likes.liked: — The beds were very comfortable and LG televisions nice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My partner and I stayed at this hotel that we booked through priceline, and it felt as if we we're treated as "lower tier" humans for doing so. When we had a complaint, the clerk at the front desk made it a point to remind us that we booked our room through priceline, making us feel belittled and unworthy of staying at their establishment.
reviews.title: Genuine rip-off

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our complaint was that the clerk that registered us in charged $100 to our card, unbeknownst to us. The front desk manager, although apologetic and polite, stated he would call our bank and reverse the charges. The next day he promised us he did make the call. He never did, and our bank verified that no call was ever made. He told a bold faced lie right to our faces. And this was their manager! All of the front desk personnel we were in contact with really needed an attitude adjustment and/or a severe refresher course in good customer service.
reviews.title: Great customer service

reviews.text: Unless you paid full price for one of their rooms, expect less than great customer service. The location and room itself were so-so, and as a previous poster said, they do try to gouge you for your money at every turn. No coffee pots in the rooms, which, for a 4-star hotel, should be a given. $13/day for internet; most other hotels I've stayed at offer free Wi-Fi. No alcohol can be brought in; they say it's the law (although I haven't found it anywhere online), even though they can serve it to you in their lounges and restaurants and charge exorbiant prices for it.
reviews.title: Good business hotel

likes.disliked: — Request a higher floor for better views!

reviews.text: I love trip advisor and was pleased to read the reviews for the Marriottt when making our decision for where to stay in San Francisco. I have traveled to the city many times and wanted to be close to the shopping near Union Square.
reviews.title: Best location for conferences

likes.disliked: — I'm getting tired of paying $10 a day for Internet access

reviews.text: Pros:
reviews.title: I listened to Tripadvisor about this one
Great Hotel in SFO
reviews.text: While visiting a friend in San Francisco I stayed at the Marriott. I was first amazed at the size of the hotel and it seemed to be the convention headquarters. At check-in I requested a nice size room with a city view and that's exactly what I received. The staff at the hotel was very friendly and always asked me if there was anything they could do. This location is perfect if you looking for a central location to everything San Francisco has to offer.
Hotel was great. There was nothing to fault about the rooms which were pretty large for a city hotel.
reviews.title: Great hotel in a great location
Poor Hotel
reviews.text: The reception service was good with cookies waiting on reception during check in!
The hotel is extremely busy almost 24 hours a day but this is mainly down to its excellent location. It is literally a 3 minute walk from Union Square.
reviews.title: Marriott should be ashamed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would return to the SF Marriott with any second thought. Do not forget to check out the amazing views from the bar on the top floor!!
reviews.title: Terrific Hotel
